metadata.Title: CVE-2020-0067 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
In f2fs_xattr_generic_list of xattr.c, there is a possible out of boundsread due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local informationdisclosure with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is notrequired for exploitation.Product: Android. Versions: Android kernel.Android ID: A-120551147.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0067` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-190.220
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-106.107~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-106.107~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-106.107~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1080.87
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1077.87~16.04.1

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-190.220').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-106.107~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1080.87').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1114.127').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1073.77~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1089.99~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1077.87~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1045.49~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1139.148').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1143.152').
